One method.

One will immediately attain the elimination of the ten hindrances and the five heinous crimes.
Second method.
If there are flying spirits and rakshasas entering a country,
Causing terror and disturbance to all people,
Always form the mudra and chant Namas Buddha.
With every thought, recollect and recite this dharani.
One will immediately attain the elimination of all such difficulties.
Third method.
If there are unbelieving people,
Simply focus the mind in one place.
Form this Dharma mudra.
Once great efficacy is attained,
It will cause even the unbelievers to gain faith and acceptance.

The four methods.
If a person wishes to attain powerful mastery,
Within seven days,
Facing the four directions, recite the mantra.
Using various grains, make human-shaped figures.
Place them in the four directions.

The fifth method.
If one wishes to eliminate one's own heavy offenses,
Then at the base of a city gate, perform the previous method.
The sixth method.
If one wishes to eliminate the offenses of the deceased,
Then at the head of a crossroads, perform the previous method.
The seventh method.
If one wishes to eliminate the offenses of all sentient beings,
Then in front of the Buddha, perform the previous method.
The eighth method.
If one wishes to save sentient beings in hell,
Every time, form the Buddha's crown seal and recite the mantra.
Then scatter it in the four directions.
One will then eliminate the karmic hindrances.
The ninth method:
If one wishes to give water and beverages to hungry ghosts,

Sprinkle the water in the four directions,

The ghosts will all obtain the nectar water to drink.
The tenth method:
If one wishes to save the suffering of animals,
Recite the mantra over yellow earth twenty-one times.
Scatter it over the animals and in the four directions.
One will then eliminate the karmic hindrances.
The eleventh method:
If one wishes to save the suffering and fear of falling into the realms of humans, gods, and hell,
Cut colorful flowers of five colors.
Recite the mantra and scatter the flowers over the Three Jewels and the Buddha's head.
One will then eliminate all karmic defilements.
The twelfth method:
If there are difficulties such as royal troubles, official troubles, or disputes with soldiers,
Recite the mantra over five fragrant waters twenty-one times.
Wash the Buddha with the fragrant water and pour it over one's own head.
One will then attain peace and happiness.

Eighteen methods.
If there is a country where the five grains do not ripen and the wind and rain are untimely,
One should make banners out of white silk.
Draw the Buddha's crown seal.
Incanterate the banners.
Stand them on a pole one hundred and eighty feet high.
Fill it to the top.
One will then obtain timely wind and rain, the five grains will ripen, and everyone will be at ease.
The evil ghosts and wind spirits will then turn their hearts towards goodness.
The Asura kings will not be able to obstruct.
Nineteen dharmas.
If there is too much rain and it does not stop,
Then write the above incantation on red silk.
Incanterate it twenty-one times.
Stand it on top of a pole.
Then the heavenly rain will stop in time.
Twentieth dharma.
If there are enemies and thieves arising in the country,
Write the incantation twenty-one times on blue silk.
In the center, draw Gandharva child Subhadra.
With both hands, adjust the bow and arrow.
Stand it on top of a pole facing directly east.
One will then be able to repel the difficulties of enemies and thieves, and they will retreat and flee on their own.
Twenty-one dharmas.
If there are calamities befalling a country,

Store them in a box.
One will then be able to eliminate calamities and extend blessings and longevity.
Twenty-two dharmas.
If there are many noble and humble people,
who wish to always protect themselves and obtain wealth and treasures as they wish,
they should arouse a good mind,
respectfully bow at all times,
form the mudra in front of a Buddha image,
recite the mantra seven times,
and gaze at the Buddha's face without moving.
If one performs this method in this way,
one will obtain various blessings and virtues to the full.

The twenty-fifth method.

If one can practice according to my Dharma,
